channel.title: Monteverdi
channel.description:
A discussion of the work of Monteverdi, hosted by Newell Jenkins and featuring musical illustrations.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Monteverdi and the French influence
item.description: This program explores Monteverdi's historical relationship to France and the incorporation of the French style into part of his music.
item.dc:creator: Jenkins, Newell
item.dc:subject: Sacred music

item.title: Opera
item.description: This program explores the growth of Monteverdi's style, and the difference between "court" and "commercial" opera.
item.dc:creator: Jenkins, Newell
item.dc:subject: Sacred music

item.title: Madrigals
item.description: This program focuses on the relationship between the Renaissance madrigal and the madrigal of Monteverdi.
item.dc:creator: Jenkins, Newell
item.dc:subject: Sacred music

item.title: Church music
item.description: This program explores the introduction of the concertato Monteverdi style into church music; in contrast to the Stile Antico and the Stile Moderno.
item.dc:creator: Jenkins, Newell
item.dc:subject: Sacred music
